title: The Importance of Brevity
mainContentHtml:
ì˜ì–´ê¸€ì“°ê¸°êµì‹¤ ì›Œí¬ìˆ

 

Lecturer: Abigail Shin(í•™ë¶€ëŒ€í•™ ê°•ì˜êµìˆ˜)

Date : 2026. 1. 29.(ëª©) 10:30 ~ 12:30

Place: Online(Zoom)

Thomas Jefferson said, "Never use two words when one word will do." As wordiness can muddle one's message and meaning, this workshop will show the importance of brevity in writing and give practical tips for being concise, such as eliminating false eloquence and using specific word choice. Students will then practice incorporating these tips by revising wordy passages. (ì˜ì–´ê°•ì˜)

title: Ten Tips for Effective Presentations
mainContentHtml:
ì˜ì–´ê¸€ì“°ê¸°êµì‹¤ ì›Œí¬ìˆ

 

Lecturer: Abigail Shin(í•™ë¶€ëŒ€í•™ ê°•ì˜êµìˆ˜)

Date : 2026. 1. 27.(í™”) 10:30 ~ 12:30

Place: Online(Zoom)

In this workshop, students will be given ten practical tips for improving their presentations including creating PowerPoints, improving delivery skills, and incorporating expressions for smoother transitions. Students will be shown clips of effective presentations that demonstrate these tips and that may inspire students to present more effectively. (ì˜ì–´ê°•ì˜)

title: English vs Korean pronunciation: theory and practice
mainContentHtml:
ì˜ì–´ê¸€ì“°ê¸°êµì‹¤ ì›Œí¬ìˆ

 

Lecturer: Luke Wall(í•™ë¶€ëŒ€í•™ ê°•ì˜ë¶€êµìˆ˜)

Date : 2026. 1. 22.(ëª©) 12:00 ~ 14:00

Place: Online(Zoom)

The best way to improve your pronunciation - besides practicing - is to understand how and why English and Korean pronunciation systems are different. This workshop focuses on how syllables are made in both Korean and English, contrasting them, and helping students to understand what they need to do in order to sound more natural when speaking English. With this knowledge, students will then practice accurate pronunciation of common consonant clusters that appear at the end of words, such as adding -ed to the ends of verbs and adjectives, and -s/-es to third person verbs and plural nouns. (ì˜ì–´ê°•ì˜)

title: Rhetoric, Emphasis, and Rapport in Communication
mainContentHtml:
ì˜ì–´ê¸€ì“°ê¸°êµì‹¤ ì›Œí¬ìˆ

 

Lecturer: Kara Ritchhart(í•™ë¶€ëŒ€í•™ ê°•ì˜ë¶€êµìˆ˜)

Date : 2026. 1. 21.(ìˆ˜) 13:00 ~ 15:00

Place: Online(Zoom)

This workshop is designed to empower students with the essential skills needed to become effective communicators in both written and spoken contexts. Students will learn the art of rhetoric, mastering the techniques of persuasion and influence. They will explore the nuances of emphasis, discovering how to highlight key points for maximum impact. Additionally, the class will delve into the creation of strong rapport, fostering meaningful connections with diverse audiences. By the end of the workshop, students will be well-equipped to craft compelling presentations, persuasive essays, and engaging speeches that captivate and resonate with their intended audience. (ì˜ì–´ê°•ì˜)

title: Function and tone in email writing
mainContentHtml:
ì˜ì–´ê¸€ì“°ê¸°êµì‹¤ ì›Œí¬ìˆ

 

Lecturer: Luke Wall(í•™ë¶€ëŒ€í•™ ê°•ì˜ë¶€êµìˆ˜)

Date : 2026. 1. 15.(ëª©) 12:00 ~ 14:00

Place: Online(Zoom)

What is the difference between "Will", "Would" and "Could"? Rather than looking at these words as individual auxiliary verbs, students will be introduced to a more holistic way of understanding language: by analysing its function. The first half of this workshop looks at some common differences between formal and informal language, which students will practice by writing their own written sentences, and then in the second half moves onto some commonly used functions in email writing e.g. making requests, asking for permission, and thanking people. By the end of this workshop, students will be able to identify whether a text's tone is formal or informal, what a sentence's function is, and the relationship between tone and function in English communication. (ì˜ì–´ê°•ì˜)

title: Crafting Introductions for Essays
mainContentHtml:
ì˜ì–´ê¸€ì“°ê¸°êµì‹¤ ì›Œí¬ìˆ

 

Lecturer: Kara Ritchhart(í•™ë¶€ëŒ€í•™ ê°•ì˜ë¶€êµìˆ˜)

Date : 2026. 1. 14.(ìˆ˜) 13:00 ~ 15:00

Place: Online(Zoom)

This workshop is dedicated to mastering the art of composing strong and effective introductions for longer essays and academic papers. In this workshop, students will learn the crucial elements that make up a well-structured introduction, including the thesis statement, context-setting, and the hook that captures the reader's attention. Through practical exercises, students will gain the skills to engage readers from the outset, provide a clear roadmap for their paper, and establish a solid foundation for the rest of their work. (ì˜ì–´ê°•ì˜)

title: Business and Academic Idioms for Speaking and Writing
mainContentHtml:
ì˜ì–´ê¸€ì“°ê¸°êµì‹¤ ì›Œí¬ìˆ

 

Lecturer: Ashley Dawe(í•™ë¶€ëŒ€í•™ ê°•ì˜ë¶€êµìˆ˜)

Date : 2026. 1. 9.(ê¸ˆ) 13:00 ~ 15:00

Place: Online(Zoom)

Idioms not only make communication more interesting, but they can also give the appearance of greater fluency and ease when communicating in a second language. Idioms may seem quite informal, but they are actually used quite often in business and academic level communication too. In this workshop, we will look at some commonly used idioms for business and academic situations, such as meetings and reports. Participants will see sample sentences and do practice activities to become confident using the expressions in their real interactions. (ì˜ì–´ê°•ì˜)

title: Strategies for Improving Academic Style in Writing
mainContentHtml:
ì˜ì–´ê¸€ì“°ê¸°êµì‹¤ ì›Œí¬ìˆ

Lecturer: Ashley Dawe(í•™ë¶€ëŒ€í•™ ê°•ì˜ë¶€êµìˆ˜)

Date : 2026. 1. 9.(ê¸ˆ) 10:00 ~ 12:00

Place: Online(Zoom)

This workshop will introduce 8 strategies for improving academic style and tone in your writing. From common sentence structure issues to vocabulary choices, this workshop will help writers find and correct common pitfalls and make their writing more clear and concise. Participants will have plenty of practice exercises and leave the workshop with a list of online resources to further develop their academic style. (ì˜ì–´ê°•ì˜)

title: Have + PP" - What actually IS the present perfect
mainContentHtml:
ì˜ì–´ê¸€ì“°ê¸°êµì‹¤ ì›Œí¬ìˆ <Have + PP" - What actually IS the present perfect>

Lecturer: Luke Wall (í•™ë¶€ëŒ€í•™ ê°•ì˜ë¶€êµìˆ˜)

Date : 2026. 1. 8.(ëª©) 12:00 ~ 14:00

Place: Online(Zoom)

Using the present perfect can be very difficult for Korean speakers of English; the main reason is because it doesn't exist in Korean. This workshop will be split into two halves: in the first, students will develop a conceptual understanding of what the present perfect is, and the different ways in which it can be used (there are four!). In the second half, we will spend time identifying and analysing different uses in natural contexts, and then practice using it in natural conversations. There are three goals: firstly, students will have a better understanding of the different ways the present perfect can be used; secondly, they will be able to identify how the present perfect is being used in a sentence; and thirdly, they will have an improved awareness of different verb types. (ì˜ì–´ê°•ì˜)

title: Improving Academic Vocabulary
mainContentHtml:
ì˜ì–´ê¸€ì“°ê¸°êµì‹¤ ì›Œí¬ìˆ

 

Lecturer: Kara Ritchhart (í•™ë¶€ëŒ€í•™ ê°•ì˜ë¶€êµìˆ˜)

Date : 2026. 1. 7.(ìˆ˜) 13:00 ~ 15:00

Place: Online(Zoom)

This workshop focuses on improving academic vocabulary among university students by emphasizing foundational skills, effective dictionary use, and overall language development. Many students struggle with academic language due to limited exposure to word-building techniques and lack of strategic vocabulary tools. The approach includes reinforcing vocabulary basics; teaching practical dictionary skills; and integrating regular practice. The goal is to help students become more confident, independent learners with stronger comprehension and academic communication skills. (ì˜ì–´ê°•ì˜)

In this workshop, participants will practice how to describe data from pie charts, bar graphs, and line graphs. Participants will learn vocabulary and sentence structures useful for introducing a chart or graph and for interpreting, describing, comparing, and summarizing data in writing.
